Ross thrived under Belfield, registering a school-record, 1,419 points. , 51050=He was more successful as the school's boys basketball coach from 1996-2002, posting a 76-76 mark in six seasons and leading Dieruff to the 1996-97 East Penn Conference championship., 51167=He then coached the Husky girls from 1988-92 and his teams went 35-81., 32135=And while I was just seven years old the last time the Konkrete Kids and Rough Riders played at Muhlenberg in 1968 and can't really remember whether I was at one of these games as I kid, I know my grandmother (Northampton, Class of 1934) definitely attended some games at Muhlenberg as did some of my other family members. We thank Duke for sharing his stats with the media., 168461= Dilts played three years on the interior line at tackle on both offense and defense from 1939 through 1941.  He was a powerful blocker on offense and could be depended upon to open holes for positive yardage.  Tenacious on defense, Dilts was a staunch run-stopper and a relentless pass rusher.  He scored three defensive TDs in his career.  As captain his senior year in 1941, he helped lead the team to an undefeated 7-0-3 season. Kennedy., 244378=Key date: Dec. 21 at Parkland., 138685=Saturday Aug. 30, 172835= Critelli was a two-year starter at linebacker in 1975 and 1976 and was co-captain and started at fullback in 1976.  He led the team in tackles in both years as a starter.  His size made him a physical presence inside and his speed allowed him to roam sideline-to-sideline to make tackles and to be dependable in pass coverage.  In 1975 John was 1st Team Big 8 and 2nd Team Express All-Area at linebacker.  In 1976 he was namedAP 1st Team All-State and UPI 2nd Team All-State at linebacker.  He was chosen as a High School All-American (2nd Team) based on Athletic Ability, Scholarship, Leadership, and Sportsmanship.  He was also a Northampton County All-Star and was selected as 1st Team Express All-Area and 2nd Team East Penn Conference, all at linebacker., 169166=Snyder was a three-year letterman from 1952 through 1954, playing fullback.  He was a mixture of sheer power and elusiveness and could run over defenders or maneuver past them with equal ease.   In his first two years Snyder helped his team to 12 victories, and was the high scorer and top rusher in 1954, helping lead the Stateliners to an 8-1 record and a Big 4 Championship.  He established himself as the top fullback in New Jersey and was rewarded with 1st Team All-State honors., 37030=9:30-9:40 â Catasauqua Band Performs, 168068=Hall of Fame Class of 2013, 37506=9:57-9:58 â Coin Toss, 55473=Years Played: 1962, 1963, 1964 and 1965, 435093=One time at the weekly media sessions I asked Ryan about his father and he did tell me that he was inspired by him and always wanted to make him proud. At fullback Parsons was a great lead blocker and a strong short yardage runner.  He was a rock on defense at linebacker and known for his physical play.  In 1968 Joe was UPI 3rd Team All-State and AP Honorable Mention All-State at fullback, Big 33 at linebacker, 1st Team Big 6 at linebacker and 2nd Team Big 6 as a back, and was chosen as a Northampton County All-Star at running back.   He was named the Most Valuable Player of the Easton-Phillipsburg game., 375267=He would be a huge addition to a very quick Dieruff team that advanced to the Stellar Summer League finals in August., 358995=L--Sherman 3 run (Pandy kick) 8:19 (Drive: 7 plays, 76 yds, 2:59), 41524=Sunday, Dec 1 -, 253195=The 18-for-18 series previewing 18 boys basketball teams entering the 2013-14 season continues with a look at the Bangor Slaters., 425500=Thursday, Nov 14 -          NFL: Indianapolis @ Tennessee â airs 8:00pm, 178593=Thurs., Nov. 21, 202988=6:30 p.m., 201789=2:05 p.m., 161843=Scrimmages: 10 a.m., Nov. 30 at Pottsville Nativity; Dec. 3 vs. Pottstown, Quakertown., 192944=10:30 p.m., 244153=Scrimmages: 9 a.m., Nov. 30 vs. Whitehall; 6 p.m., Dec. 4 at Hazleton., 171451=Amato was a two-year starter at linebacker in 1962 and 1963, was a tri-captain in 1963 and also started at fullback.  In his junior year the Rovers were Big 5 Co-Champions. Lafayette â airs 11:30am, 129511=Scrimmages: Today at 1 p.m., tri-scrimmage at Blue Mountain including Pottsgrove; Sat. Nov. 30 at Scranton., 170270=Mason was an outstanding player on both sides of the ball as a starter in 2002 and 2003, serving as captain his senior year.  At running back he rushed for a school record 1880 yards and scored 24 touchdowns as Phillipsburg went 9-1 and captured the 2003 Skylands Conference Championship.  Averaging 188 yards a game, Brandon eclipsed the 100-yard mark in 9 of 10 games that year, including a school record 305 yards and four TDs against Franklin.  A superb defensive back, he collected five interceptions and four fumble recoveries in his career.  In 2003 he was chosen as 1st Team All-State at defensive safety and 2nd Team All-State at running back.  He was also selected as New Jerseyâs Gatorade Player of the Year, the Express-Times Player of the Year, and Offensive MVP of the Phillipsburg-Easton game. , 104736=Openers: Saturday, Dec. 7 vs. Notre Dame-East Stroudsburg; Tuesdsay, Dec. 10 vs. Northwestern., 161986=Opener: Dec. 7 vs. Easton at Becahi in Yasso-Rothrock Tournament., 52956=Head Coach: Bob Mushrush (1948 and 1949) and Champ Storch (1950 and 1951), 37264=9:54-9:55 â Away Team (Catasauqua) Enters Field, 56232=Years Played: 1965, 1966, 1967 and 1968, 427142=Monday, Nov 18 -            NFL: New England @ Carolina â airs 8:00pm, 435939=Spadola went through a lot of adversity in what was largely a stellar career at Lehigh. You might remember "Tweetgate" during the 2011 playoffs when he was suspended for the playoff game at North Dakota State for retweeting a tweet that included a racial slur., 384393=For example, in 2009, South defeated Liberty in the quarterfinals but lost by a lopsided margin to Easton in the semis., 387733=Parkland 21, Whitehall 14 -- These two, in my opinion, are the two best teams in the area and it's sort of a shame one will be packing up the uniforms come Saturday. I will be at Zephyr Stadium with colleague Stephen Miller and will have Twitter updates. Just like in the game above, there's very little to pick from here. textBeforeTable: American Athletic From the National Football Foundation: Television Football, Categories: Total People in Discussion: 0 Complete weekend college football TV schedule, including tonight's games November 21, 2013 Digg It Add to del.icio.us | Linking Blogs | Trackbacks | Comment | Permalink | I just wrote about Frank Lane, the former Easton running back who is now a Parkland assistant. Frank is most proud of the fact that he will be inducted into the Phillipsburg/Easton Hall of Fame on Thursday morning at 9 a.m. at Fisher Stadium, prior to the 107th meeting between the Red Rovers and Stateliners in one of local sports' greatest rivalries. Lane is one of eight inductees who will be saluted inside Lafayette Collegeâs Kirby Sports Center, This Hall of Fame class includes four players or coaches from each school.  After careful research, inductees were selected from a long list of eligible candidates.  Membership is based
